description: After the Loyalty Lottery code leak, Rada Miskovic, weighing the unrest and the ongoing manipulation, decides to broadcast her entire archive of secret Council footage, BCI logs, and interviews. She slips an encrypted data package to a trusted state media contact, activating a scheduled citywide release.

Screens across Stenograd light up with synchronized broadcasts: Council arguments, BCI manipulations, internal disputes, and evidence of systemic cover-ups appear citywide. Citizens watch in shock as the truth behind years of governance is revealed.
Public uproar intensifies as people sift through the newly-released archive. District assemblies organize emergency meetings, confronting former officials and debating possible paths forward.
Halden's final recorded message proposes an annual amnesty and a referendum on forgiveness. Neighborhoods host open debates, with sharp divisions emerging around the future of the BCI.
A citywide referendum is held: citizens choose between erasing punitive BCI records, codifying forgiveness, or dismantling the system entirely. The vote defines Stenograd's next chapter.
